DID YOU KNOW?
Crestview is home to an eSports team that competes under the Crestview name in the Ohio eSports League. The group has about 30 members with 15 of those regularly active in the typical three meetings per week schedule.

The team is currently in their Winter Open season which gives them time to practice for the upcoming competition season beginning in March. This past fall the team went 1-5 in their inaugural season playing Super Smash Brothers Ultimate. They hope to add new game options in the future.

eSports has given several members an opportunity to socialize and compete in a school activity that interests them and become part of a team. The Ohio eSports League requires a GPA of 2.5 or higher while members must also be 13 or older and not have any failing grades from the previous quarter.

Van Wert Elks #1197
December 10, 2019 at 8:10 PM ·

Van Wert Lodge No. 1197, Benevolent and Protective Order of Elks have selected Laney Jones and Michael Joseph, both seniors at Crestview High School as the recipients of the Students of the Month for November.

Students are nominated by their high schools to receive this award. Each Student of the Month receives a monetary donation along with a certificate from the Van Wert Elks Lodge 1197 with the possibility to be named the Student of the Year. Students are judged on the basis of multiple achievements – Volunteerism, Character, Leadership, Service, Citizenship and Scholastic.

This program is designed to recognize outstanding young men and women for their achievements in school and community. The Elks wish to recognize and praise those students for their accomplishments, their activities, and their contributions to society through this program.

Pictured left to right are: Linda J. Stanley, Student of the Month Chairperson with Michael Joseph and Laney Jones.

Crestview Local Schools welcomed Melissa Cropper, Ohio Federation of Teachers President and Secretary-General of the Ohio AFL-CIO, to our district today. Ms. Cropper toured the school, witnessed our staff and students in action in their classrooms, enjoyed a luncheon with teachers and staff, and discussed concerns from administrators, board members and teachers related to educating our students.
It was an honor to host Melissa, and we look forward to seeing her work and collaboration with us make a positive impact on education.
